abstract: The total may come to around $29 billion, but the company may generate $30 billion in cash flow this year. Still, the disaster isn’t over yet.
snippet: The total may come to around $29 billion, but the company may generate $30 billion in cash flow this year. Still, the disaster isn’t over yet.
lead_paragraph: Things are looking up for BP. Signs that the British energy company is close to halting the flow from its leaking Gulf of Mexico well have helped its shares rise more than a third since touching a 14-year low in late June. The financial impact of the disaster is now a bit easier to quantify.

headline.main: Tallying BP’s Bill on the Gulf Coast
headline.print_headline: Tallying BP’s Bill on the Gulf Coast

byline.original: By FIONA MAHARG-BRAVO and ROBERT CYRAN

abstract: Hedge funds are cheering Consumer Reports’ somewhat damning review of the iPhone 4, as they await an “Apple slingshot,” Jason Schwarz writes on Seeking Alpha.
snippet: Hedge funds are cheering Consumer Reports’ somewhat damning review of the iPhone 4, as they await an “Apple slingshot,” Jason Schwarz writes on Seeking Alpha.
lead_paragraph: Are hedge funds cheering Consumer Reports’ somewhat damning review of Apple‘s iPhone 4?

headline.main: Are Hedge Funds Hoping for an Apple ‘Slingshot’?

abstract: Some former iPhone owners, tired of the AT&T network and Apple’s walled garden, are trying out Google’s Android platform.
snippet: Some former iPhone owners, tired of the AT&T network and Apple’s walled garden, are trying out Google’s Android platform.
lead_paragraph: I’ve seen it a thousand times: Sit down for coffee or a meeting and those in attendance automatically reach for their cellphones and place them on the table. It’s almost like a subconscious signal that says ‘I’ll be sitting here for a while.’

abstract: Hundreds of thousands of apps exist, but new ones are welcome. Here, app ideas from parking to getting dressed.
snippet: Hundreds of thousands of apps exist, but new ones are welcome. Here, app ideas from parking to getting dressed.
lead_paragraph: The original 2007 iPhone had only one screenful of software icons, believe it or not. You couldn’t install any new ones of your own. It took a whole year before Apple opened the iPhone app store, making it possible for the masses to download and install new apps (programs) and, in the process, creating a whole new gadget category.
